title: Poverty risk rate in Belgium 2008 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing At-risk-of-poverty rate, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2015.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2010 to 2008.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2015 to 2014.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2014 to 2013.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2013 to 2012.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2012 to 2011.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2011 to 2010.
gold: Between 2008 and 2018 , roughly 15 percent of the Belgium population was at risk of poverty , defined by Statistics Belgium as 60 percent of the average disposable income in the country . People with an income lower than this are considered poor . In 2018 , this definition matched nearly 16 percent of the Belgians .
